text: Wilmer Santiago Acasiete Ariadela (born 22 November 1977) is a Peruvian retired professional footballer who played as a central defender. He also holds a Spanish passport due to the many years he spent in the country, mainly with Almería,Acasiete ya es espãnol (Acasiete is already Spanish) ; UD Almería, 9 July 2007 with whom he appeared in four La Liga seasons. Acasiete represented Peru in three Copa América tournaments. ==Club career== Born in Callao, Acasiete started playing professionally with Deportivo Wanka, moving in the following year to Universitario de Deportes. After another sole season he joined Cienciano del Cuzco, helping the former country's capital side to the 2003 South American Cup and the 2004 South American Supercup. For 2004–05, Acasiete signed with UD Almería in the Spanish second division. He was an important defensive element in the Andalusians first-ever promotion to La Liga in 2007, being used intermittently in the subsequent seasons however: in his first top level campaign in Spain he appeared in only 20 games, but still managed to award his team six points with last-minute home strikes against Sevilla FCAlmeria 1–0 FC Sevilla; ESPN Soccernet, 1 December 2007 and Villarreal CF (both 1–0).Almeria 1–0 Villarreal; ESPN Soccernet, 13 April 2008 Following the end of 2011–12, spent again in the second level, 34-year-old Acasiete opted out of his contract with Almería and returned to his former club Cienciano. ==International career== Acasiete gained more than 40 caps for the Peru national team, the first on 18 February 2004 at almost 27, and participated at the 2004 and 2007 Copa América. On 7 December 2007, he was found guilty of having introduced women and alcohol into the national squad's hotel two days before Peru's away drubbing at the hands of Ecuador (5–1), and was thus suspended 18 months (1.5 years) from international competition (national sides only).Peru ban Farfán and Pizarro for 18 months; Reuters, 28 March 2008 On 3 July of the following year, after an investigation and a review of the facts, the suspension was changed to three months (from the date of appeal in April) with a US$10,000 fine. ==Honours== ===Club=== ;Cienciano *Copa Sudamericana: 2003 *Recopa Sudamericana: 2004 ===Country=== *Copa América: Third-place 2011 ==References== ==External links== * * * * * Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Callao Category:Peruvian footballers Category:Association football defenders Category:Peruvian Primera División players Category:Club Deportivo Wanka footballers Category:Club Universitario de Deportes footballers Category:Cienciano footballers Category:La Liga players Category:Segunda División players Category:UD Almería players Category:Peru international footballers Category:2004 Copa América players Category:2007 Copa América players Category:2011 Copa América players Category:Peruvian expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in Spain Category:Naturalised citizens of Spain Category:Spanish people of Peruvian descent Category:Peruvian expatriate sportspeople in Spain
